intro: Securidaca spinifex, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed margins, and its flowers are typically arranged in umbels. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Securidaca spinifex is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils.
